I was able to connect to wifi with my Kindle fire in my room, but with this device I only have 1 bars... I have purchased a wifi extender which does make it much better but I am still disappointed in the device in terms of wifi.

Reviews.Title: I can't put this tablet down.
Reviews.Author: Ichikoh
Reviews.Content: I own several tablets, and this one has all the featuers I've always wanted in a tablet.  The obvious feature is the gorgeous screen, even for a LCD.  The resolution is top notch and clear, the size is perfect.  The build quality is better than I expected.  The back cover is soft leather like, which does not scratch or leave fingerprints.  I can easily palm it, and it so thin.  After turning out on, I notice it's blazing fast.  The Touchwiz launcher does lag, but with Android, is not limited to stock.  I changed the launcher and presto, its a totally new tablet.  I don't know why people complain about the software, there are a several ways of changing to your style.  The memory is expandable to 64 GB...which comes handy to store all your apps, music, video, and pictures.  This is probably the biggest difference from other tablets, because they cannot expand, so whatever size hard drive comes with it, that's it.  The battery is great, after heavy use, I still had a fair amount of battery left.  Other features...the speakers are on the bottom, which I like very much, led light on the back, great camera on the back, and home, menu, and back buttons on the bezel instead on the screen.  Overall this tablet is close to perfection.

Reviews.Title: The tablet makes my phone look like a toy
Reviews.Author: Timothy R. Culp "tim"
Reviews.Content: I thought my phone had such a nice display until now. Love the size. 7 is too small and 10 is too large. Screen is beautiful. The only issue I have is the font size can be very small on apps like facebook. I occasionally need reading glasses to use it. Otherwise I would have rated it a 5.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet with some quirks.
Reviews.Author: gB
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4 is a solid tablet with an amazing screen and a very desirable size/format (8-inch range).  There are a few quirks listed below, and at the moment the price seems a bit high (though dropping from its release price), but overall this is a solid device and recommended if you're looking for an Android-based tablet.Pros:*No surprise here, but the screen is really awesome.  Very high pixel resolution and the screen "pops" with bright, vibrant colors.  It's very easy to read small text on the screen.*I'm one of the few people, I guess, that actually like Samsung's custom TouchWiz skin over the plain-vanilla Android experience.  That's been my main motivator for purchasing the Galaxy S-series and Note phones over the years.  The GTP UX has been updated significantly to reflect a new direction and be more tablet-centric, but so far I really like it.  A lot of the classic TouchWiz features are still there, just a bit different than previous Tabs or S phones.  If you've used previous Samsung tablets or phones, you'll feel right at home with this model.*Ultra-light and thin.  The 8.4 format is a great size for this tablet.  Big enough to be a worthy addition to my phone, but smaller than the bulkier 10- or 12-inch GTP models.  The tablet is very light and thin, making it very portable and easy to hold.*So far the tablet seems fast and responsive to me.  Others have commented that it can lag, but after a few days of moderate use, I haven't noticed that yet.*A lot of people compare this to the 2013 Nexus 7, which is priced considerably cheaper.  Although, the GTP 8.4 has its quirks, I think the build quality and user experience is better than the Nexus 7.Cons:*The auto-brightness functionality doesn't seem to work too well; perhaps it can be fixed with a software update.  I've had multiple Galaxy-branded devices over the years, including my Note 2, and the auto-brightness feature has always worked pretty well in most cases.  The GTP 8.4 seems to be unusually dim when the auto-brightness feature is turned on.  If you move the tablet to other lit areas in the room, the screen will auto adjust, but this is somewhat of a pain and is inconsistent.  I find myself keeping the auto-brightness setting off in most cases.*Speaker placement.  In fairness, this affects all of Samsung's smaller tablets, going back to the Tab 7.0 and 8.0 models.  The speakers are placed at the bottom of the tablet when held in portrait mode, which is great.  However, if you want to watch a movie or video (landscape mode), then the speakers will be on the right or left, and the sound will obviously be biased to one side of your head.  I realize this is not a huge issue, since most of the time I'll have headphones on when watching movies so close to the screen, but it is still annoying.  As a side note, the iPad Mini has the same design (speakers on bottom in portrait mode).  I believe the Nexus 7 places the speakers at the top and bottom in portrait mode, so that when you hold it in landscape mode and watch movies it is more naturally tuned to your ear.*Price seems a bit high for what it is.  Compared to the iPad Mini Retina, it's priced fairly, I suppose; however, Apple is the king in this space and they can afford to charge more given their customer base.  If you shop around, you'll find it listed below the original MSRP.  However, compared to other smaller Android tablets, including the Nexus 7, this thing seems overpriced.*Only 16gb.  Sure, the microSD slot is great, but Google has heavily restricted Android 4.4 to run or store apps on external space.  As others have noted, some of the offline GPS apps will not work with this tablet, since they cannot be stored on the microSD card.  In this day and age there is no excuse not to offer 32gb+, especially at this price point.*Galaxy Tab 4 coming?  Recent news reports and rumors have it that the Galaxy Tab 4 is coming very soon.  Really, Samsung?  If that's the case why in the world did Samsung release the "Pro" line?  Samsung is notorious for releasing far too many similar products in a short window.  Even worse, once they release a new product, they typically abandon the previous version.  So if the GT4 line is around the corner, then I expect future software updates to the GTP line will be minimal, if at all.*No hardware "menu" button.  This is probably my biggest pet peeve with the GTP 8.4.  Okay, this is actually not Samsung's fault at all--Google took out the capability for a physical "menu" button in Android 4.4.  Per the Android 4.4 specs, the GTP 8.4 has replaced the menu capactive button with a "recent apps" button.  However, I've noticed a lot of apps have not been updated to support the "soft" menu that Google wants its apps to have.  After years with my other Galaxy phones, I've come to rely on this functionality.  For some apps,  Samsung has added the ability to long-press the "recent apps" button, and you'll see the menu appear.  However, I've noticed that it doesn't work for every app out there.  I understand Google's intentions with this removal, but it's up to the app-maker to move the menu into the app screen itself, and many developers have not made this change yet.

Reviews.Title: Great 8 inch Tablet
Reviews.Author: blackocat
Reviews.Content: I bought the Samsung 8.4 TabPro and my girlfriend bought the Apple IPad Mini Retina.  I set up both devices and both took about the same amount time. Both have excellent displays and seem equally fast.  My preference is for the Samsung, but It is completely subjective.  I prefer the KitKat interface and having a back button. The Word processor that comes with the Samsung seems better (more Word like) than the Apple Pages product. I also like the keyboard better on the Samsung because the top row has numbers.  Text editing seems easier on the Samsung too. Both products offer the same popular apps.  The Chrome browser also does a really good job hiding rows and maximizing the viewing area while scrolling.  The speaker are fairly good too.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, but some limitations.
Reviews.Author: -TMcN-
Reviews.Content: You've read the other reviews.  You know that the 8.4" has a great processor, great display, decent software, etc.  And those rare horror stories that usually have nothing to do with the product.What's the rest of the story?This is a great tablet, but...1. No USB mass storage mode.  If you have an older Android device you're upgrading from, you may be used to plugging it into your computer and copying files back and forth.  Not so easy on this one.  It supports two modes: Media (MTP) and Camera.  No USB drive mode.If you root the tablet, you can enable mass storage mode, but that invalidates your warranty... and prevents future firmware updates.If you're using the latest (but not so greatest) Windows version, it pretty much works anyhow, a bit more limited (can't reach all the same places) but you can see it.  On the Mac... not so much.  But there's a way around it.  Look for "Android File Transfer" for the Mac; it's not quite the same, but closer.2. Still no TAP VPN support in the kernel, which is a big deal for OpenVPN.  Of course, there wasn't before, but you could root and get it.  Fortunately, there is an app that somehow implemented it... search for it.colucciweb.openvpn.  It costs about $5 (most OpenVPN clients are free, because it is an open source project), but it works.3. You may be accustomed to having buttons below your screen for Menu, Home, Back and possibly Search.  The SM-T320 (the 8.4" Tab Pro tablet) has, instead, "Task Manager", Home and Back.  No "Menu" button.  I guess they figured all apps have been updated to use the on-screen menu dots at the top, but many haven't. To get the "Menu" functionality, HOLD the "Task Manager" button instead of tapping it.4. You can't, without installing a different launcher, disable the Magazine page of the launcher.  It's a bit like Metro (Microsoft Windows Phone), though only required on one page.  But if you're a power user, you probably do install your own launcher anyhow, and it actually is decently nice.5. The back is leatherette.  Fake leather.  But guess what... it's actually pretty nice.  No rattling on the table, it is a bit classy.Really, they're easy enough to live with, but keep these limitations in mind.  On the bright side, if you register the device, you get some nice perks including a $25 credit for the Google Play store.  (Ironically, I forgot about that until AFTER I paid for that Open VPN Client software.  Oh well...)6.  No mini-HDMI port.  This may fall into the "Say what?" category for you, but most Motorola devices have had them.  With a single cheap cable, you can attach to any HDMI-accepting TV/monitor.  With an iPad, it takes a $40+ "Lightning" cable.  You need a special cable for that, an MHL 2.0 HDMI adapter.  Samsung's is the ET-H10FAUW.  And yes, it's $40.  You can get it on Amazon... but it sucks down the battery like Pac-Man eating Pez, and recent versions don't work run through a receiver; you need to go directly to the T.V.7. No USB OTG.  Well, not really at any rate.  USB OTG is a newish standard for allowing phones and tablets to read/write to USB Flash Drives.  (Overly simplified version.)  This requires software support and the ability to send a bit of power to the USB port.  The Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4" can't do it, not directly.  It requires an adapter.Is this a negative review?  No, not really.  I'd still buy it again.  It's pretty, it's fast and it takes 64GB micro-SD cards.  (Reportedly it does well with the new 128GB ones too, but I haven't tried it.)  But do be aware that not all is violets and roses with Samsung's newest jewel.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Upgrade!
Reviews.Author: Chris Leach
Reviews.Content: Ok, I bought my nephew the Galaxy Tab 8.0 for Christmas and have been using it and enjoyed it so, that I was about to buy the same thing for me.I seen that the GT Pro 8.4 had come out and had a better screen than the GT 8.0, so I thought I would study a little about it, read a few reviews online and then I would decide on which to get.I can say that I definitely chose right.Just some quick Pro's from my use so far :Width wise it seems smaller than the GT 8.0.Screen is heads above the GT 8.0The .4" screen size is NOT noticeable at all.  My hands hold the GT Pro as well as the GT 8.0.Loads apps/books faster than the GT 8.0.  It should with a quadcore processor.The fake leather backing on the back of the GT Pro is nice, it isn't as likely to slide on any surface that is not flat.Charge seems to be holding up, but I have only been using it recently for reading books.The speaker seem good considering this thing really isn't being advertised as a mp3 player.Some quick Con's:When I slide my finger to go to another screen, it stutters at times. (haven't had time to see if there is a fix or not for this)The fake leather on the back just seems tacky and not right for the GT Pro.  I don't hate it, but it seems something better could be there instead.The speakers and sound aren't what they should be, in my opinion.  Maybe they should invest into Beats audio or some other brand of audio to up the sound quality.  The GT Pro, should have better sound, not just a better screen.This has been a pleasure to use so far, though I clearly have not put it completely through its' paces, I have used it and abused it a bit, and it does very well.I would recommend this over the Galaxy Tab 8.0 in a heartbeat.If you are struggling between the 2, the Pro is the one to get, even at the cost, but you can't go wrong with either really, but the Pro is a step up that you can see and feel.

Reviews.Title: 2.5 month usage review incoming!
Reviews.Author: Cool Spot
Reviews.Content: I'll put my review in:Purchased this tablet March 21st, 2014 from here for 360. White, 16GB version.I previously owned a Kindle Fire HD 7" (16GB, 2012 version) and also own a Samsung Galaxy S3, White, 32GB version.I'm familiar with the Samsung build quality, so the Tab Pro 8.4 having all plastic wasn't a big deal to me. I put a case on it that folds into a stand and haven't looked back! Screen is nice, text is on the small side at times, but that's more of the insane resolution than anything else.HDMI out works perfectly. I made a topic and corresponding video about it on AndroidCentral's Galaxy Tap Pro 8.4 pageSound quality is loud but isn't the best, so I purchased a Bluetooth stereo speaker to take care of that. Wifi range seems alright, but it disconnects every so often. Not a big deal as the wifi on/off is very instant. Multi-Window works great, though I wish it would allow Hulu Plus and/or Netflix to work with two apps at once.Memory Capacity seems good. I haven't had any storage or ram issues. The camera takes decent pictures with a flash and auto-focus. More notably fuzzier than on my S3 phone. The screen edge to the bezel is nice, but I found I would sometimes drag the screen when I'm holding or moving my tablet around which would cause undesired functions on the device itself.I don't use Magazine UX so I took most of the widgets present, off, as to reduce the lag. I find that if you don't even swipe in that direction, you have nothing to worry about. Android games play flawlessly. Currently playing Walking Dead Season 1 (bought the  Season Pass with my $25 Google Play Credit).Lastly, the battery life seems good. I keep my device on the charger when I'm at work or out of the house anyway, so it never gets below 30%. The included white Samsung Charger charges the battery up quite fast due to the higher mAh rating. I don't have the brightness on full, maybe 1/3 of the way up and don't use auto-brightness because it's too dim. For viewing at night, I use this program called Easy Eyes that automatically dims the screen at dusk (and brightens again at dawn) to make it easier to see at night. It works great. Same idea as f.lux on Windows/Mac PCs.----------------------------------Overall, for my first "true" Android tablet (hated the KFHD), I would rate it a 8.5/10. Not a bad rating by any means. I just have nothing else to compare it to so it's pretty much at the top ceiling for me!

Reviews.Title: Apple Who? iWhat?
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This tablet is the smallest in Samsung's pro series but it completely blows my wife's iPad Retina out of the water!I swore off Samsung after back to back crappy phones several years ago. This was pre-smart phone and the biggest problem was the batteries they used. However, I am on the Samsung band wagon now! I had a nexus7 that bricked on me 3 months after the warranty was up and I loved it... This blows it out of the water.I dont need near the power this bad boy offers but it sure is fun and at the price how can you go wrong? On a side note 6 days after my purchase Amazon lowered the price $30 and when I called to say something they refunded the difference no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: Lots to Love About this 8.4 Tablet. Thin, Lightweight & Great Display
Reviews.Author: Carrie
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to love about the Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4 inch tablet.  And, there are a few annoying things too.  All in all, however, the positives outweigh the negatives, and, for non-business use, the Galaxy Tab is a strong contender in the tablet arena.What to Love:1. Bright, clear display2. Easy to set up/intuitive3. Quickly downloaded my contact information (from outlook/hotmail)4. Expansion slot allows for a 64GB microSD card5. Lightweight & thin - hard to notice that you are carrying anything at all6. Decent battery life7. Easy to connect to wifi8. Decent rear/back cameraCould be better:1. Gmail emails are in a different folder/app than other emails (hotmail, roadrunner, etc). It would be nice to have them together.2. The tablet chokes on large/extra-large file downloads/transfers (was transferring pictures from the microSD card to an attached USB flash drive)3. Manipulating non-gallery stored pictures (viewing, deleting, moving using touch rather than a mouse) is cumbersome4. Need to use a USB adapter in order to use a flash drive5. Sometimes had a hard time connecting to wifi (showed connected, but couldn't open internet)I did not try to do document editing or use the tablet as a remote.I travelled overseas with the tablet & loved the fact that it is lightweight & very packable.  I used it daily to connect to the internet for emails & social media.I've used a Sony Experia tablet (10" Android), a Surface tablet (Windows) & the Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro tablets.  Of the two Android tablets, I think Samsung is a superior tablet.  As compared to the Surface, the Tab Pro is more lightweight, but the Surface can handle larger file downloads and is more functional as a business tablet because Word/Excel/Powerpoint are seamless applications.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade from Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: sal "salby"
Reviews.Content: Love the Galaxy Tab's larger screen--crystal clear and beautiful colors. I am  uprading from a Nexus 7 2013 as I read so much and needed a larger screen.  The Tab Pro is very fast, performs without problems, and is easy to hold.  I am a small person,  but with a good case.  the Galaxy Tab Pro is comfortable in my hands and handled easily. A great upgrade and perfect for the many tasks for which I use a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Best 8-inch Android tablet available
Reviews.Author: Bruno
Reviews.Content: Great tablet! Delivered the goods in all aspectsScreen: Extremely sharp, text, images and games just pop out of the screen. Colors are also very sharp, yet the color accuracy is great, especially the whites. While the iPad produces notably warm whites, the Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4's whites are as accurate as tablet screens go. Contrast is also very good on this tablet. The 8.4 inch size offers a lot of screen real estate, all the while being very portable.Design: While I prefer the iPad's aluminium build, the Tab Pro 8.4's faux leather back doesn't look bad at all. On top of that, the tablet is really, really thin and light, and the screen bezels are very narrow, though the top and bottom bezels are big enough for comfortable landscape mode use. I must point out, however, that if you choose to use this tablet in landscape mode, know that your hands will activate the capacitive back and menu buttons A LOT. It's pretty annoying, and after a while you'll just switch to portrait mode and keep it that way.Software: The included software is generally very useful. Multi-window is a feature I've been enjoying the most. The WatchON app, together with the tablet's IR blaster, makes watching TV much more convenient. Magazine UX is very nice, but it lags down the tablet too much, hence I sideloaded the Google Now Launcher and it's been running VERY smoothly. Hancom Office is also the most complete Office alternative I've ever seen, but I found that it hangs a little too often.Performance: Overall performance of this tablet is great, thanks to the Snapdragon 800 processor. Web browsing is a very smooth and fast experience on Chrome, and the stock web browser is even smoother. Even demanding games like Asphalt 8 run very smoothly. But, again, the stock TouchWiz launcher with Magazine UX will slow things down.Basically, it's an excellent tablet, and the best iPad mini Retina competitor available right now.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, just a couple of small technical drawbacks
Reviews.Author: Scott W. Larson
Reviews.Content: All the good reviews are true. The screen is beautiful and the CPU is fast. This works great for downloading photos from my DSLR, cropping them, resizing them and even correcting the color (the display can be color-calibrated) before I forward them onto my boss. I've found two small problems that few will care about but here they are.The Wifi isn't very fast. I rarely get transfers faster than 1MB per second and usually get half of that even three feet from the Wifi router. In the same location my laptop regularly transfers 9-10 MB per second. Copying files through MTP transfers at 3-5 MB per second so that's the way to go if you don't mind plugging in a USB cable.Video and audio acceleration in hardware is missing some important codecs. The most surprising is that AC-3 (better known as Dolby Digital) is not supported. This is the most common audio format used on DVDs and the only format used for high definition television in the U.S. The native video player simply says "Unsupported audio codec" and you get no sound. There is also no hardware acceleration for MPEG-2 video which is the standard format for DVDs and high definition television -- the default video player says "Sorry this video cannot be played".This means that if you want to drop any file on the tablet and expect it to play, you will need another video player which will support these codecs through software (MX Player plays every file I've thrown at it). If you want to maximize the battery life by using hardware acceleration, you'll need to reencode video from DVDs or HD broadcasts into codecs that are supported by the hardware like AVC and MP3. This is a surprising inconvenience since even my phone supports these in hardware.

Reviews.Title: Replaced iPad mini with this tablet
Reviews.Author: Gary Woods
Reviews.Content: I like that this tablet has GPS, quad core processor and a Micro SD slot. High resolution display is excellent.  The only disappointment is that Android 4.4.2 limits using apps from the external SD card to Google apps.  I would recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Samsung takes bite out of apple! This device is awesome!
Reviews.Author: John Edwards
Reviews.Content: This tablet form and size was a little awkward at first. I had been using an iPad with retina display but wanted a smaller device to travel with. I liked the Samsung 8.4 much better, so dumped the iPad.Dislikes:The bezel is too small and sensitive. The capacitative control buttons are in a tough spot for my large hands. To fix this, I purchased the IVSO case. With its hard back and soft front cover, the device is easier for me to grasp. Further, I turn the device upside down so the buttons are on top. So 90% of my problems are solved.Likes:1) I love the keyboard which includes a delete key and backspace key, plus right and left cursor keys. On top of this you can simply touch the text to edit.2) The main controls for brightness, wireless, gps, blue tooth and sound are very easy to access. This is important if you travel by air and land.3) The screen is spectacular. Very bright and no pixelation even up close for night time reading.4) Battery life is very good. Especially if you turn down the brightness and leave bluetooth and gps off.5) Conventional micro USB charging plug is just the right thing to do. Proprietary apple connectors now seem contrived, however profitable they proved for Apple shareholders.6) The sound is darned good for two little  bottom side bezel speakers. I mostly use in-ear head set.7) Apps and Storage: Free 50 Gb Dropbox is nice, though I will like never use it all. Free 3 Audible books is enough to get you hooked! Hancock Office works very well.8) Samsung connectivity is cool. I am dying to use it on my Samsung TV. So far I haven't tapped the video aspect of this device the than Netflix. Nflx works well!9) Kit Kat is very easy to navigate.  Though some icons are not as pretty as Apple equivalent. P10) Play store is on par with the apple app store. I purchase my media from Amazon, so content is not encumbered by Apple proprietary limitations.Summary:Get a case! Tons of inexpensive variety online.Find top 10 app list and play around with this incredible device.Enjoy superior performance!

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet out there
Reviews.Author: zomgwtfbbq
Reviews.Content: Samsung really caught up on the Tablet market. This is the concurrent pendant to the iPad retina mini and the Samsung Tab Pro 8.4 beats every other tablet out there by far, including every product from Apple..10/10 superb screen, superb colors, incredible resolution. Incredible Hardware inside, fast as lightning. Sleek and nice design.If you are looking for a new Tablet, this is the best you can buy currently.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet out there
Reviews.Author: D. Kean "D. Kean"
Reviews.Content: Ok, I've only had it for a few days but I've been checking email, monitoring an eBay sell and its been over 24 hours and still have 100% battery.  Don't know if it will drain quickly at some point but so far so good.  Beautiful screen.  Can't say anything bad about it.  y on response

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Carlos Costa
Reviews.Content: I can't rave enough about this tablet. The size, the speed,  the OS, and of course the screen! I honestly can't think of any negative factor towards this tablet, and I would have to say it blows anything else on the market away in its class. If you have a Samsung smart TV it goes even further. The features are endless even for a person like me who is a technology freak. Strongly recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: I love my tablet.....Stop it Apple trolls
Reviews.Author: Sean Robinson "The realist"
Reviews.Content: Im aware of the Apple trolls writting reviews for the tablet......hilarious!!! My tablet goes with me everyday to work or play..... no issues...on wifi..no issues......period. No issues....at all. My only issue is with otterbox..that as of yet has not made a case for this model. If Apple trolls want to drink the koolaid..thats fine...but trolling without pay??? GET A DAMNED LIFE...this Tablet is good...it has more apps than I need but I'll take it. The 25.00 in google money works just fine too.....with Apples you only get seeds ..in your mouth....if youre into that kind of thing....I just saying.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Stan Dov
Reviews.Content: I decided to downsize from my previous 10.1" tablet of a different brand as I found it to be too awkward to hold during my commute and the tab pro 8.4 has worked out nicely! The tablet is light, easy to hold with one hand, and the screen is big enough. My needs are fairly simple - I don't use the multi window functionality that Samsung has provided - it does work, but I simply have no need for it. Mostly I use it for browsing the web, processing and posting photos (taken with my 36 mp camera) when travelling, and watching movies. The tab pro 8.4 is pretty snappy while performing/switching between these tasks and the screen - 2560 by 1600 - is the sharpest you can get right now. Absolutely no complaints about any of that. The battery is fair and when I fly long haul I make sure to take an external battery pack with me (mostly for a piece of mind - haven't had to use it yet). The biggest con about this tablet is that it's only available as a 16 gig version. Sure, you can store media on the external microSD card, but when it comes to apps - you will have to prioritize the apps (some games run a few gigs!) that you will have installed. Overall I am pleased with the product.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Mickey 3 Gun "M3Gn"
Reviews.Content: I've used it daily now for about a couple of months.  Other than it having limited accessories because it's so new, I have no complaints

Reviews.Title: Awesome first tablet
Reviews.Author: chr0nix
Reviews.Content: Amazing tablet. Disable the Samsung touch wiz launcher by installing Nova Launcher or Google Now to make it fly. 8.4 inches is the sweet spot for tablets.

Reviews.Title: No problems
Reviews.Author: Writ Xavier
Reviews.Content: This tablet is working very well. You know what the specs are; this is a high-end tablet. I was very pleasantly surprised by how long the battery lasts (much longer than the 6 hours it claims here on Amazon). As a quad-core, 2.3GHz processor is massive overkill for most tablet applications, I generally keep it in power saving mode (which limits the CPU frequency), and only put it in full-power mode when I am doing compute-intensive tasks like solving systems of linear equations. I'm a computer scientist, and I have been able to use this tablet as a highly-portable research platform when I'm on-the-go. If you're just a casual user who wants to watch movies and browse the web, the less-expensive Galaxy Tab 4 series (which I also own) is probably a better fit.

Reviews.Title: Really good
Reviews.Author: Pedja
Reviews.Content: Display is amazing! Colors and resolution are awesome! It`s really fast due to its 2.3 GHZ CPU, and It`s really light which is perfect for gaming and watching videos. Sound is good and it`s pretty loud. Battery life is really good. It can hold up to 8-9 hours if it is heavily used (games for hours + facebook + internet surfing + youtube). Under light use ( a little bit of games, FB, email, youtube) it holds up to 3 days.I disabled most default applications. For example Samsung magazine is boring and annoying. I can browse fun stuff my self using dolphin player and youtube. Also Google chrome does not support flash player (hacked version for kitkat) and its slow. Magazine and other default apps I never use just reduce battery life, slow down tablet and take up space. Rooting the tablet would probably be the best solution.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Vincent Kruzel
Reviews.Content: Excellent tablet for my needs. I use it every day. I bought a gum drop cover for it to protect it.

Reviews.Title: Love the galaxy tablet!
Reviews.Author: sherry jacobson
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and so very light for traveling. Great for business and organizing both your personal and professional lives

Reviews.Title: Tab Pro 8.4
Reviews.Author: Velociphile
Reviews.Content: The display's, color, clarity/resolution are phenomenal! Combine that with the power of this tablet they are the main reasons I decided to finally purchase my first tablet which I used to replace an aged laptop.I love the size, fits great in my hand, I really enjoy reading and watching videos on this tablet.I do have issues with the WIFI constantly scanning and occasionally dropping off due to some error which is only fixed by turning the tablets wifi off then back on.I wish it had the indicator LEDs for charging or email/messages like my phone does.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: Robert Olmsted
Reviews.Content: I have both the 8.4 and 12.2 and i can't say enough about them if your sitting there scratchingYour head about them stop and get either one of them or in my case get both you won't go wrong

Reviews.Title: Better then all the rest
Reviews.Author: LHoskins
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4 is hands down the best tablet that I've ever owned it's lightning fast has a great display perfect for professional users like myself and those people who just want the best 8.4 tablet around okay one con it's like four hundred dollars but it's 369.00 now every where, do yourself a favor buy it buy it buy it you'll love it love it love it! I'm done!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I love my 8.4 pro. It is a bit pricey compared to other tablets, but it is way faster, the screen is beautiful, runs apps quickly, surfs the net like a pc, and I popped a 64gig card in it and it uses it effectively. So I got a high end tablet with 80 gig for $399. Not easy to do if you are looking at IPADs. And this thing compares well with IPAD. For me the size is perfect too. I fly a lot and watch movies. The 8.4 in screen is big enough to enjoy movies but small enough to fit in my brief case or use in my hands. Sure beats watching the movies on my phone. Yes the battery life maybe only five hours instead of 10 but that is plenty for me and it still goes for one or two days if I am not using it to constantly watch movies. Also the infrared remote and online TV guide is awesome too. I travel between two places and it let me set up seperate rooms so I can use it in NH and FL. One reviewer rejected it altogether becasue of the limited power  and I think (s)/he was an IPAD snob just looking for excuse to put down machine. I did take away one star becasue of the limited power, but am glad I spent the money on a pro instead of the regular tablet. I also have an IPAD 2 for my wife who doesn't mind it being slow but I can tell a big difference. You can even use the usb port to read from flash drives so you really have a lot of storage capability if you need it and with my movies and music I need it.  I installed Amazon mobile app and get free apps of the day which also eat up space but are a lot of fun to try.

Reviews.Title: the best android tablet available
Reviews.Author: seon
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal screen, fast processing speed, very useful multi-tasking feature , ample battery life, tons of interesting features and perks, highly customizable, good speakers, good weight. Only downside is its price. Overall, my wife and I are very satisfied with this product.Note: In order to receive perks, register your device at the samsung website.  Google "register galaxy tab pro for perks."

Reviews.Title: Best tablet I've owned yet
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Olsen
Reviews.Content: I've had 3 android tablets, Surface RT as well as Pro and the Galaxy 8.4 is exceptional, Samsung continues to impress and exceed my expectations each time I buy one of their devices. This tab is blazing fast, picture quality is next to none. The form factor is perfect which allows you to type with two thumbs. The only downside I see thus far is it gets slightly warm with heavy use but that is expected with something this fast.

Reviews.Title: Better than my Nexus 7!
Reviews.Author: KingNigel
Reviews.Content: This tablet is awesome. I'll just go ahead and list the pros and cons..Pros:Great screenComes loaded with features to make up for high price. (Dropbox, Google play credit, etc)Good standby timeHaptic feedback/vibration (something the nexus 7 lacks)Feel in the handCons:-Camera. Now I know most people are thinking "Who cares about camera quality on a tablet?". Well, taking away the camera completely could have saved $50 on this product and made it competitively priced.-Speaker placement. In landscape mode, your hands will cover the speakers a bit. Although I don't get irritated by itI recommend this tablet for everyone! No matter how simple or big your purpose is. Not usually a big fan of Samsung and Touchwiz, but I'm 100% satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly...
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: The Good:Screen size, processor speed, and balance/weight distribution. The Battery life is about 5 hours or so which isn't that great but isn't that bad either. A little better than Nexus 7, I think.The Bad:The home button and touchable back and application keys are in the worse possible area as with the sound. Your hand is literally covering up the sound a lot of times (which gets muffled really bad if you don't watch yourself), accidentally hitting the touchable keys, and it wasn't design with landscape in mind even though that is how you would use it a lot of times for games. Also, hate the Magazine UX that you can't disable or uninstall and even if you replace it, it's still integrated so deeply into the system that it uses resources.THE UGLY:You have a 16 gigabyte hard drive but 4 gigs is used by the system and then maybe another gig or so in bloatware, so you are left with about 11 gigs for yourself.What makes me annoyed even more is the SD card slot doesn't transfer all of the apps to it, most of the application size is stored on the internal memory still and only resources seem to be installed on the sd card which is less than 20 percent of the application in games.For example: The Squid 1 game is about 400 MBs but only like 60 MB is actually put onto the card.So your memory gets eaten up just as fast on the internal while your external SD is overflowing with memory. Sigh.What's more annoying is the ram the system/bloatware uses is about a gig and a half out of the 2 gigs: so you are left with about half a gig or about. Most of the time my ram memory is about 80 percent used with just a few apps opened.So, to sum it up, you are left with a device which is really 11 gigs of usable hard drive space, half a gig of usable ram or around 800 megabytes, and has a lot of bloatware which Samsung denies you from removing. You have the keys in the wrong areas, applications can't be installed on the SD completely and most of the application data is on the internal anyways, and you probably are going to have to juggle apps by installing and uninstalling them from google play at some point.I almost want to return it but it's not that bad of a device: just feels like it was made lacking on purpose outside of specs which would get people to buy it but who knows.Take care,

Reviews.Title: My First Tablet
Reviews.Author: Melody M.
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews, I just read them because when I think about buying a product, I really want something worth purchasing, especially for the price, and something that I at least think will last me a while. I am very careful with my electronics because they can be really pricey. I read and watched every single review I could find on youtube, google, amazon, etc. to help my decision about whether to buy an iPad, Nexus, Samsung or a Kindle. I'm sure its pretty obvious that Samsung Galaxy won my vote.  Although, there are some cheaper brands out there, I want a good and solid tablet. Tab Pro has been really good for me so far.  I haven't had any regrets yet and if you ask my husband, I do have regrets from time to time when it comes to my purchases.  I always go to Amazon first when it comes to buying products because they always offer great prices and it arrives fairly quick and in good quality.

Reviews.Title: LOVE SAMSUNG
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Waller "book luva"
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet.  It has everything you need to do on the run.  you can't go wrong.  A must buy.

Reviews.Title: Better than Retina
Reviews.Author: Bill Blackburn
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a bright, sharp & beautiful display!  359dpi; way better/sharper resolution than Apple's best Retina offering on any device they make.  And bright; I can read it outdoors on a sunny day (not that I do that much).  The Tab Pro 8.4 is faster than my wife's older Tab 2 7.0" & my buddy's iPad 2.  This is especially noticeable when surfing the web.  One complaint that actually applies to all tablets I've looked at, the rear/main camera resolutions are typically lower than current smartphones.  This one has an 8MP main camera, while my Samsung Galaxy Note 3 (bought Oct'13) has a 13MP main camera.  Enjoy . . . :-)

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet with some quality control issues
Reviews.Author: Kevin T
Reviews.Content: 1st tablet I received from Amazon had speakers that made a low muffled crackling sound while volume was muted.  Replacement tablet from Amazon worked perfectly.This is the best screen you can get on a tablet, and 8.4" is the perfect size, and weight.The only negative is the Samsung bloatware and Touchwiz/Magazine launcher, which has some noticeable lag.I installed the Google Experience launcher and now the tablet is perfect.  It's like a premium Nexus device with a bigger and better screen.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic tablet.
Reviews.Author: lily
Reviews.Content: I've had this galaxy tab pro 8.4 tablet for a week and it is the best I've ever had!!  The screen is so clear and crisp, it is lightning fast, I like the new magazine format, and the battery life is great.  If you don't want to use the magazine format you don't have to, the home page is the regular android that we are use to.  I just love everything about it.  Samsung has out done itself in my humble opinion.  I have used the the Samsung tab 8, the nexus 7 2013, and the Kindle Fire HDX, and this new Galaxy is by far the best!  The faux leather back is very nice, very soft feeling.  It is very light to hold, no hand cramping.  The price is a bit high, but in mho worth every penny.  I say go for it, you will be amazed!!  As usual ordering it from Amazon was great, it arrived in 2 days with prime, and packaged perfectly.  Enjoy!! Should add one more important point....the battery charges very fast...within about 2 hours!!  WOW!!

Reviews.Title: Best on the Market
Reviews.Author: Mr. Daniel W. Brennan
Reviews.Content: It took me a long time to invest in a tablet but when I did I ask myself why so long. This Galaxy 8.4 is just a good or even better the the computer I have at home. This Pro Tab is very easy to navigate with the touch screen. Great Job.

Reviews.Title: Pros and Cons
Reviews.Author: James Foldenauer
Reviews.Content: I choose a 4 out of 5 rating because there is some pros and cons to this Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4. First, I will explain the pros of this tablet. The Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4 has a nearly 2k with a pixel density of around 350, the highest in the market. The performance is outstanding as I would get a score around 23,000 in Quadrant Standard Benchmarking test (similar score to Galaxy S5). Finally, the tablet is light and thin that makes it more portable. Next, I will explain the cons of this tablet. The cost of this tablet is $399, which is expensive for some people to purchase. The speakers is not the best, it gets the job done but the quality is low comparing to other tablets. Finally, the battery is not the best according to the comparison. The specs on the Samsung's official page shows the internet usage of 10 hours, music for 126 hours, and watching a video for 12 hours. With these pros and cons, I would still recommend this tablet to users that is in interest of getting a tablet.

Reviews.Title: the best
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: Great display, lots of features need time to process all the features.Was going to purchase a cheaper version but changed my mind. The display is a perfect size for my old eyes!Samsung has always been the best choice for me,never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Misleading Product Description
Reviews.Author: Tracie E.
Reviews.Content: The tablet itself I totally love. I purchased this model as it was a lot like my Galaxy phone, and the controls are about the same. Also comes with KitKat OS which was a plus. Only comes with 16GB of memory, so if that's a big deal for you, you may want to spend the extra $50 to upgrade to the 32GB.My only gripe is that in the product description, Amazon made it sound like a lot of perks came with it. Such as a $25 Google Play Credit, Hulu Plus, and GoGo Inflight Wifi.  This greatly influenced my decision to purchase this model, as it made it sound like an even better deal. Sadly, it did not come with these perks. You could only get them from signing up with Samsung Perks, and even then Samsung did not offer them.So I would say the tablet is great, but don't let the product description fool you or influence your choice.

Reviews.Title: Not entirely multilanguage
Reviews.Author: Cyrius Almeida
Reviews.Content: i love the tablet and all but i thought it was multilanguage. as i turned it on, i noticed that it didnt have brazilian portuguese as a display language. i hope samsung fixes that in a near future so my wife can be happier with it :)

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Paige
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best tablet I have used! Functions are great and so nice to have. There is an option to take a screenshot by swiping the side of your hand over the screen and other smart screen functions. The find my Galaxy Tab feature is a huge bonus and such a nice feature! It is super fast and responsive. Definitely a quality product!

Reviews.Title: Great Tab
Reviews.Author: AKK "AKK"
Reviews.Content: this is a very very fast tab, impressive response with KitKat.amazing screen.good memory ( 2GB )sound is OKgreat for reading

Reviews.Title: This is a good tablet
Reviews.Author: Doug Elfman
Reviews.Content: This is a good tablet. I do most of my work on it, instead of on a PC or Mac. For a while, I preferred the 2013 Nexus 7 to this tablet, actually, but with time, I've come to see the 8.4 is just more amazinger. The best screen. The best multitasking work stuff. Quick. Good battery. The only thing this tablet suffers is lack of support for Android Runtime (ART). I put Android Runtime on my other tablets and it makes them faster than this 8.4. I have asked a Samsung representative online if the company will push out an Android Runtime update, but I was basically told not to hold my breath. Too bad. Because when the Google 8 inch tablet comes out in third or fourth quarter, I'll probably buy it and sell this awesome 8.4, because, I mean, to run Android without ART is shooting yourself in the foot.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Gina
Reviews.Content: This device is great! I originally bought the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 which I returned for this device. This works perfectly and the operating system is GREAT. IT also syncs up with my phone with NO problems! It's wonderful.Battery lasts much longer than the specs say at 6 hours, at least with casual use. Not sure yet how it runs with continued use for 6 hours.the ONLY reason it didn't get a 5 star is because I wish it was about a .5" bigger. The Kindle I had was 8.9" and surprisingly that half inch makes a difference.Either way I love the product and I'm so glad I bought it!  I also love that I can add memory if I ever need it.

Reviews.Title: Power in a small package
Reviews.Author: Zayeir Bent
Reviews.Content: I've been shopping for a tablet for quite some time until i caught wind of this from a friend. Being in the military, this is a great tablet to have while out at sea. Overall, this one of the most powerful tablets in its size on the market. The micro SD slot makes up for the lack storage and the resolution boost is  much appreciated.  This is a great buy for android users or anyone looking to pick up a powerful tablet however, the price point may turn consumers off who are looking at similar sized tablets.Pros: Resolution, Micro SDCons: Price for some, Unnecessary Apps is turn off.

Reviews.Title: BEAST resolution
Reviews.Author: Kevin Vo
Reviews.Content: This is the best tablets I have seen so far. I got the ipad mini retina, but the color and the screen is not so great as this tablet is. Performance is fast even though the Touchwiz is still a bit laggy. Try it and enjoy the resolution of the tablet

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4
Reviews.Author: Glen
Reviews.Content: Number 1  tablet in the world. It has metallic edges now, very nice look and fast performance. So far, I have not encountered any freezing problems at all. This was meant to upgraded and replaced my old Nexus 7, and it did.

Reviews.Title: Favorite tablet
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I must say this being my first tablet has set the bar very high on the competition because all I can say is this tab pro 8.4 is awesome

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: Lots of bells and whistles...Can't wait to do more surfing and get more use...Glad I decided to buy...I'm enjoying my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Perfect companion to Samsung Galaxy S4 phone
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good size tablet; fantastic image. Easy to set up, especially if you're comfortable with Android.Perfect companion to Samsung Galaxy S4 phone. Apps purchased through Amazon and Google Play don't have to be bought twice.Cons: WiFi reception is a little weak; dropped connection that was steady on S4. No other complaints.Overall: Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: fun
Reviews.Author: Charles Dunnewind
Reviews.Content: Works well and does what I thought it would do. Size is good. Easy to use and understand. Battery runs out with some use, sooner that a ereader

Reviews.Title: just plainly love it
Reviews.Author: Snakeyees
Reviews.Content: the screen is so clear it's beautiful, everything I throw at it applications it runs flawlessly no lag very happy just wish I could afford is a bigger screen

Reviews.Title: excellent device
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Ascanio
Reviews.Content: I thought this tablet had an option for 3g it doesn't but still is a very good device. I fully recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Tab Pro 8.4
Reviews.Author: c®c_31
Reviews.Content: I really loved my Tab Pro 8.4 since the day I got it from our local supplier.Stunning screen display.Highly Recommended buy!

Reviews.Title: Love it. !!!
Reviews.Author: Mafalda Quinn
Reviews.Content: I have an 8" galaxy note, and this one is an improved version, fast, glorious screen, decent camera. I only miss the stylus.  Very happy with it.  And i know that if they come with a new Note version  of this Pro, will get it too..

Reviews.Title: Just Right
Reviews.Author: aqualeo
Reviews.Content: This has everything I wanted in my new tablet.  Not too big nor too small, the size is perfect for me.  I also like that Samsung has its own store for purchasing apps.  I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Tablet!
Reviews.Author: C. Stence
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying a tablet - I settled on this despite the somewhat "higher" price compared to what's out there. TOTALLY WORTH IT! The interface is beautiful, intuitive and smooth as silk right out of the box. The Samsung "skin" doesn't appear to slow things down at all and is quite helpful. It also doesn't limit usage of standard Android features or access to Google Play. In fact, it seems like all the added perks and bonus that Samsung added are outstanding! I still haven't finished finding all the goodies that Samsung has added to this perfectly sized tablet. Way to go Samsung!

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: scott collins
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with this product so far. The speed is good. The apps work well so far. I love the remote pc app.

Reviews.Title: Galaxy 8.4 is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Craig Durrell
Reviews.Content: The screen is amazing!  In the brightest sunlight,  it's beautiful and easily readable.Gaming is pushed to new levels of speed thanks to the Snap Dragon processor.When used in the panoramic mode my right hand covers the two speakers sometimes.  I hope the next new model places them in a front facing location.The 8.4 Galaxy Tab is well made, useful for hours (9+), and I am very pleased overall.The informational booklet is worthless however.  Fortunately Youtube is your friend and that's where I learned most of it's operation.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!
Reviews.Author: S. Curtis "Peek lover"
Reviews.Content: Samsung never lets me down and hasn't started yet. There is a learning curve, but the display is AWESOME!!! Also can't figure out how to make the weather icon smaller, it's like half the screen but I'll figure it out.

Reviews.Title: First Impressions
Reviews.Author: Molly
Reviews.Content: I really like this tablet. The display is bright, and the text is sharp. It is a nice device for older folks, because Samsung software has a user friendly feel. You can customize the setting with ease.I don't want to come out with a list of negatives. I am just wonder where are the good quality cases for this device like the "Snugg".

Reviews.Title: My first tablet
Reviews.Author: Bottleofwhat
Reviews.Content: And I am satisfied with my purchase. The main factor that decided my purchase was the fact that this is the latest and best in the tablet arena. Although there are obviously lower price points to jump into the tablet game, the Tab 8.4 feels like premium hardware at a time where most other tablets are nearing their end of life cycles.Observations: The multitasking is great although still hiccups at times, hoping a software update or android development smooths it out.Samsung also needs to come out with better protective cases for their premium devices at time of launch, what is currently out there is lackluster.

Reviews.Title: Great product, but slightly pricey
Reviews.Author: C. Suan
Reviews.Content: This is my second tablet, 1st one was ASUS TF300t, but spoil by my kid after dropping from staircase.After using for a month, below is my summarize:Battery performance:The full charge battery is sufficient for my daily activity, I average spends 3hrs reading & surfing, while 2hrs for gaming. It usually drop to 20-30% before sleep and i left it charge for overnight. Once I encounter the battery indicator stagnated at 100% after 5hrs usage, but after reset, the indicator back alive. Another incidence was the battery didn't get full charge, it always goes saturated after 61%. After refix my 2 pins power plug from wall, the problem resolved, suspect due to bad contact.WIFI signalThe signal sense is strong. Even i get 1 bar of signal, it still load webpage faster than my old TF300t. But for Splashtop (i use it to remote my desktop), not sure why the display will hang after 30sec but sound still continue, I don't face that issue with my old tablet.Graphic, display, Sound & CameraThe high ppi make the 8.4" display clearer. It out perform my old 10" tablet. There is some lagging on Dragon Age game, not sure is that cause by graphic limitation or CPU performance issue. Sound quality is average. The camera quality is below average.

Reviews.Title: couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: R. Kaur "Sheena"
Reviews.Content: My brother got this tab, and he loved it so much that he even changed his iPhone to a samsung galaxy. The tab is very light and much more useful compared to an iPad.

Reviews.Title: WIFI issues
Reviews.Author: R1
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed is the WIFI seems to have problems staying connected.  We have other Smart Phones and tablets that have no issues staying connected to the same networks.  You can search the net and find others that have also noticed this.  Question is, is this a hardware issue or something that can be fixed by a software push.

Reviews.Title: Buy It Buy It Buy It!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Mallory Olsen
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Gorgeous piece of tech. Light weight, sturdy, fast response, brilliant screen (even at half brightness).  I'm a musician, I use my tablet for work and play.

Reviews.Title: Not as small as I thought
Reviews.Author: My Fake Name
Reviews.Content: *****I had gotten used to an Android 10.1-inch tablet when this product arrived, the Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4-Inch Tablet (Black).  I assumed I would be disappointed by the smaller size, which according to my simple math is 16.83% smaller.  Although that's a considerable difference in sheer screen size, it seems to be made up for by the extreme clarity and brightness of the display.There are many times I need to zoom in and back out using the product under review, but that was the case no less often with the 10.1-inch model.The Tab Pro 8.4 can be held portrait-wise in most people's hands.  My 10.1-incher can be so only just barely and then only if you have larger than average sized hands and only then if you take a break every so often.  The 8.4-incher can fit in more places such as pockets in clothing or pockets in a handbag than the 10.1-incher, i.e., it is more portable.For this, compared to my only other tablet, I add one star to five.You will probably want to add a micro SD card, which can range up to 128 gigabytes.  The unit comes with 16 gigabytes of internal memory, of which maybe 11 are free, which isn't a lot.  If you don't intend to add many apps or music or photos or any other space-hogging things, then maybe 11 gigs are enough for you, in which case ignore the first sentence of this paragraph.  You don't have to decide right away; just keep an eye on how much free space you have in internal memory, and if it gets too small then buy an SD card.  If Moore's Law is correct, and it has been for quite some time, the longer you wait to buy storage space such as a micro SD card the cheaper it will be.*****The device does not, repeat not, have a telephone in it.  If you say to it, "Call work" or "Dial work" or "Call [ . . . ]" (not my real work number) it completely and totally ignores you.  I mean 100%.  No flashing light, no confirming beeps, no matter how plainly you speak and no matter how directly into the microphone.  Even if you shout, which disturbs people sleeping nearby, for which I subtract one star from six.  There is no keyboardly way to make an outgoing call either.  I swear.  As to incoming phone calls I have never received any whatsoever that I know of.  Sometimes I think maybe I received one and I shout at the tablet, "Accept" or "Answer" but nothing ever happens.  Based on this evidence I conclude the Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4-Inch Tablet (Black) really does not have a telephone in it.  The evolution of some smartphones' getting bigger and some tablets' getting smaller will surely eventually intersect in a perfect size or two, and I think it will be just about around this size.  A fully operational tablet with a telephone in it is what I want.*****The product under review underwent unusual tests at my hand I thought you'd want to know about.  First, it will not survive a drop onto concrete from a height of two smoots; thereafter it did not start.  Second, it will not withstand being left out in my back yard in the rain and snow for a winter; thereafter it did not start.  Third, it will not tolerate being attacked dead center by a .22-caliber rifle round and then by a 20-pound sledge hammer; thereafter it did not start.Still, I find this to be a wholly satisfactory tablet, not as small as I thought it would be, if you remember what I mean.  The sum total after adding and subtracting various stars is five.  The product delivers what it says it will, and if the size is right for you then you should buy it.*****

Reviews.Title: Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4 a Winner
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic device and rates 5 stars.  I highly recommend it.  The only thing I can't do with it is make a phone call, which is just fine.  It is light weight and very powerful.  This is a must have device.

Reviews.Title: tab pro 8.4 is a beast
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing tablet I've ever owned. It is fast and it feels great in the hand. The size I think is perfect, portable yet productive. 3 thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: Love it, Love it, Love it
Reviews.Author: Albert Tuten
Reviews.Content: Those were the words my wife said to me as I gave her birthday present a little early.  It does more than she will ever learn to do.  I love it too, when she lets me get my hands on it.  I've held it twice in 45 days.  Great job Samsung!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Device
Reviews.Author: Bader alqahtani
Reviews.Content: I can said this tab it is the best tab ever i have used itQuality of the material it is excellent

Reviews.Title: I really wanted to love this, but...
Reviews.Author: J. Robinson
Reviews.Content: I can't get over the fact that Google has made it so that Flash no longer works with Kit Kat. I've tried several workarounds, but none seems to consistently work.Maybe it's not fair to lower the rating of the tablet for Google's doings, but...I REALLY wanted to love this over the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9, but I'm finding the HDX more to my liking. I've side-loaded Flash and the Dolphin browser on the HDX and the combination works fast and fine.Update: 04-27-14The tablet has been returned. Having a tablet that won't allow me to access flash just doesn't work for me. If this is the track Google is going to take with Android, then I just will have to stick with my Galaxy Tab 3 8.0 inch tablet for the foreseeable future. I might even consider switching to another platform if flash is available and the battery-life is comparable.

Reviews.Title: great tablet. great screen size. great performance.
Reviews.Author: Torture
Reviews.Content: Amazing tablet.The screen resolution is just out of this world.You just need to use a loader to get rid of samsung's customizations. They kill the performance.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Has met or exceeded all my expectations about form, function, design, performance, you name it.Have used it extensively for several days and have yet to find a weakness. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Device, but...
Reviews.Author: Tim Oien
Reviews.Content: For $400 I thought there would be NOTHING wrong with the tablet. The screen is GREAT!!!! Like the size right between a 10 inch and 7 inch. But for $400 the screen is a little unreceptive and the device is hard to hold by itself without a case. Just got my case today so over the weekend was a little pain to use.

Reviews.Title: Crippled by a simple missing feature
Reviews.Author: rich campoamor
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a replacement for my Nexus 7.  I quickly found out that Samsung has crippled the device by not implementing the feature to automatically update the date and time from the network.  This feature is on every other KitKat-based Android device.  Not implementing this feature causes problems with some apps (like Twitter) and also means that the user has to manually update the date and time on the device when they travel.  This seems like a curious decision on a device that Samsung is pitching as a 'Pro' or business oriented device.I have contacted Samsung support via their web site, Twitter, Google+, Facebook and other channels and they refuse to even acknowledge that there is a problem.  They have no answer when I point out that the missing feature is referenced in the product documentation, but doesn't exist in the Settings section of the device.Not allowing users to disable the ugly 'Magazine' interface is also a big negative.  This is easy to 'fix' by downloading Nova Launcher.  Nova allows you to avoid the ugly TouchWiz interface and Magazine but still use the multi-app functionality of the device - well worth the couple of dollars Nova costs in the play store.I find I continue to use my Nexus 7 rather than the Samsung because it doesn't support the software and features that I need.  I wish I could return it as it has turned out to be a VERY EXPENSIVE mistake.  Samsung's lazy/ineffective support has moved me from a strong advocate of Samsung tablets to a vocal advocate of alternatives.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: C. Layburn
Reviews.Content: Convenient and easy to use. Good price. Only wish on/off and volume button were easier to access while in case.

Reviews.Title: Tab pro 8.4
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: I like my kindle fire hdx 7 much much better. Better speakers and better picture. Go with kindle. Very confusing and it's filled with a bunch of bloat ware.

Reviews.Title: Horrible speakers
Reviews.Author: Fozborn
Reviews.Content: Great tablet but horrible speakers.As others have said the speakers crackle when the volume is muted and using an app that would normally play audio. It could be as simple as the unlock swipe if it is muted.To check, turn media volume down, open YouTube or something that would play audio like a game, and listen. If you don't hear it you are either lucky or try it in a quiet room, ghold the speakers up to your ears.I have had this problem with 4 separate tablets all the 8.4. Some white, one black. They all have the problem. I have reported it to Samsung each time and I know from forums that others have as well. However, Samsung denies that there is a problem, or that it has been reported.Fix the issue Samsung!

Reviews.Title: Best tablet yet..
Reviews.Author: BigDan
Reviews.Content: The tablet was wonderful very easy to read bright screen and super fast. The only problem I had was it went from 99% to 75% off in 7h and that was everything off nothing running in the background. I then tried to test a youtube video that just after 17min it drained 11%. The worst I had was after a 2h movie it would drain maybe at the most 25%.So since they don't have any instock I have to wait till maybe late March to try again.

Reviews.Title: Far from the best
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Ok. Samsung makes great products we already know that. But why keep the capacitive and big physical buttons on the bottom of the tablet.  What a major headache holding this thing.  Im always hitting one of the 3 buttons and closing the screen, etc. And its even twice as bad using it in landscape.  I returned mine for this reason.  I then purchased the lg gpad. They did the buttons right.  Virtual on the screen.  And you can change the order of these because it is done in software.  So much better than the samsung.  Before you purchase this unit try the gpad.  Its so much better to hold. And feels better in the hand.

Reviews.Title: Not Recommended to buy
Reviews.Author: satishchandrakolli
Reviews.Content: Display and performance are really GoodBattery is the worst ...Android and Samsung need to improve how to maintain long battery

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected given what was promised
Reviews.Author: B Klemz
Reviews.Content: I bought this expecting a lot and that may have been the problem. It is an Android tablet with lots of upgrades and Samsung promised all sorts of things that it just didn't deliver. Based on their website and write-up on Amazon, I expected...I expected a super screen, I got a clear but unexciting screen (really no better than the normal resolution screens on other tablets and NOT better that the Retina display on the Apples). I expected super high performance, I got a slow or no better than the normal Android tablet performance (games were a misery). I expected easy setup, but it took 7 hours and was repetitive (it asked for my email 8 times before I stopped counting). I expected all the included apps to work as described, they did not (their Cloud is a real monster to set up and if you have an Apple device you will be really angry at how poorly it works). I expected solid linkage with my iTunes music library and I got nothing of the sort, I could not get my music on this device in any usable format. I expected seamless function with streaming video sources like Netflix and I could not for the life of me get the included Netflix app to work and I could not delete it and download the newest version directly from Netflix (I have no idea how well Hulu works, I gave up after all of this).On the plus side it is well made, it boots quickly and surfs the web easily. Their onscreen "keyboard" is wonderful and the default browser is Google's Chrome and I like that, but for well over $360 (tablet and 32GB micro SD) I was really disappointed. So, I called Amazon and they took it back.I really like Amazon's policies in this regard. If you buy something and it 1) doesn't work or 2) it doesn't work as described, they take it back no hassles. Once I mailed it back I bought another tablet, an ASUS MeMo for around $140 (with case no less). The kids have one already and I have to say theirs works as well as the Samsung Tab Pro 8.4 for 1/3 the price.Oh well, you don't always get what you pay for. Lesson learned (yet again).

Reviews.Title: Caveat Emptor
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Love the tablet but not Amazon.  I will admit it is my fault for not doing more research or research in the right direction.Amazon has not released an app to play Prime videos on Android devices.  How hard can it be to program one since their FireOS is a subset of the Android OS?  And no, I should not have purchased a Fire as we already have one.  The Samsung fits other needs/requirements.  Prime at $99 a year is no longer worth it.

Reviews.Title: i cant connect to internet( problem resolved)
Reviews.Author: allan
Reviews.Content: I got the device yesterday it was delayed it supposed to arrive two daysBut it takes 8 days. It looks like it was an open box it doesnt arrive with a sumsung seal it was tape on both end. and now i cant somehow connect to the internet if i cant fix this ill return it. Its disappointing.UpdateIm loving this device now the only problemIs the device storage 16gb is never enoughIf your a heavy user like downloading apps. Even though it has a mmc expansion sometimes appsDoes not store on it.

Reviews.Title: NOT SATISFIED
Reviews.Author: VENKATA UDAYAGIRI
Reviews.Content: HANGS OUT OFTEN, MY DOCUMENTS ARE NOT OPENING, CAMERA IN THE NIGHT IS NOT GOOD, IRRITATES A LOT, MAY BECAUSE I AM USED TO APPLE PRODUCTS I FEEL SO.

Reviews.Title: For some this might be just fine. For me this is useless. I'm spoiled by my Note 2.
Reviews.Author: S. McAllister
Reviews.Content: This is a vary powerful device that has been locked down so hard that compared to a laptop or a smartphone it is a good door stop.What I recommend is to get the best and largest screen smartphone that you are happy with. The smartphone is 100 time more useful than this tablet.
